pr_title: Add the singleton scope to beans produced by the JsonbProducer

timeline.bodyText: JsonbConfig is not thread safe. So I don't think it's a good idea to share the instance. Do we really need to expose it as a bean?
timeline.author: mkouba

replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
By making it a bean users are able to supply there own configuration by means of a CDI producer, which you of course know is super helpful :).

So an alternative could be to fire an event of type JsonbConfig when creating a Jsonb instance so that users can observe the config and modify it. But this would break the compatibility of course.

So let's just remove the @singleton here and add a comment on why we can't make it @singleton, OK?

Sounds good enough. If there is a doc about overriding the JsonbConfig bean we should mention it there as well.
replies.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText:
@loicmathieu can you adjust your PR to only make Jsonb singleton.
Also I would add a comment for JsonbConfig: "JsonbConfig is not thread safe so it must not be made singleton."
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: must be @Dependent maybe? It can't be @ApplicationScoped or any other scope that is shared.
replies.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText:

replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
I switch to @Dependent even if it's the default scope so it's explicit that we want it.
I added the comment.
I also add the two scopes to the documentation so if someone provides their own beans they know which scope to add to them.
